subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Roger Federer overcame Pete Sampras’s stubborn resistance en route to a 7-6 (6), 7-6 (5) victory in their second Asian exhibition match, in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.Federer won their last encounter, by 6-4, 6-3 in South Korea on Tuesday, but the clash in Malaysia took nearly 90 minutes and proved a bit more difficult.Their age difference might have been the decisive factor — at 26, Federer was never in danger of losing against an opponent a decade older who retired from competitive tennis five years ago.Sampras, who has won a record 14 Grand Slams, showcased his big serves and hit ferocious forehand returns. “He played some unbelievable shots, but then again, he is capable of doing that,” Federer said.“He had an incredible serve which was so difficult to read tonight.”.
